sentences.english: In addition, most overseas migrants settle in North Island.
sentences.chinese: 另外，大多数海外移民也定居在北岛。

sentences.english: Agriculture Most of the cattle farming is in North Island.
sentences.chinese: 农业大多数牛场在北岛。

sentences.english: The waikato university in New Zealand's north island Hamilton city.
sentences.chinese: 怀卡托大学位于新西兰北岛的汉密尔顿市。

sentences.english: The Waitomo Glowworm Cave is located in the Waikato region of NewZealand's North Island.
sentences.chinese: 魔萤火虫洞位于新西兰北岛的怀卡特地区。

sentences.english: What separates the north island and the south island?
sentences.chinese: 北岛和南岛由什么分隔开？

sentences.english: Prof. Bei Dao was conferred an honorary degree of Doctor of Letters by Brown University.
sentences.chinese: 北岛教授获美国布朗大学颁授荣誉文学博士学位。

sentences.english: Kitajima is the new era poetry, but in any event around the island.
sentences.chinese: 北岛是中国新时期诗歌无论如何也绕不过的岛屿。

sentences.english: New Zealand's North Island and South Island, mainly composed by the Cook Strait separating the two islands.
sentences.chinese: 新西兰主要由南岛和北岛组成库克海峡将两岛分开。

sentences.english: Malmqvist and the mainland poet Pei Tao discuss his poetry together.
sentences.chinese: 图为他与大陆诗人北岛讨论诗集。

definition: Ernest Hemingway (1899-1961), American novelist and journalist
Mishima Yukio (1925-1970), Japanese author, pen name of (平岡公威|平冈公威, Hiraoka Kimitake)
Rabindranath Tagore (1861-1941), Indian poet and writer
MURAKAMI Haruki (1949-), Japanese novelist and translator
Misty Poetry, a post-Cultural Revolution poetry movement
William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet
Khalil Gibran (1883-1931), Lebanese poet, writer and artist
Oe Kenzaburo (1935-) Japanese novelist and 1994 Nobel laureate
